question: Is celecoxib effective for treatment of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis?
ideal_answer: No. In clinical trial celecoxib did not have a beneficial effect on research subjects with ALS, and it was safe. A biological effect of celecoxib was not demonstrated in the cerebrospinal fluid. Further studies of celecoxib at a dosage of 800 mg/day in ALS were not recommended.

snippets.text: NTERPRETATION: At the dosage studied, celecoxib did not have a beneficial effect on research subjects with ALS, and it was safe. A biological effect of celecoxib was not demonstrated in the cerebrospinal fluid. Further studies of celecoxib at a dosage of 800 mg/day in ALS are not warranted.

Prostaglandin E(2) levels in cerebrospinal fluid were not elevated at baseline and did not decline with treatment.
INTERPRETATION: At the dosage studied, celecoxib did not have a beneficial effect on research subjects with ALS, and it was safe.
